Text.Value: So, lovely as it is you to have you back, mother - go away. You have work to do.
So. This cult - what's our plan?

EditorData.NodeContext: Straight to business - not even brooking the idea that she won't be involved with our efforts

Text.Value: Take what you need, and we'll do the grand reunion when you come back for good.

EditorData.NodeContext: Bulling through the sentimentality - she's releived to have her mother home, but doesn't want to actually relax until she's home for good.

Text.Value: Right. Leave them to us, then. If we can't get them past the checkpoints, we'll at least make sure they're watched over if it comes to fighting in the streets.

EditorData.NodeContext: Working it through a moment, then matter of factly taking on the job we've given her.

Text.Value: There are refugees outside the walls. They'll need protection.
We're working on it.
No arguing. Just tell me you're well.
Wait. One more thing - there are doppelgangers on our trail. One even went so far as to steal my face.
Jaheira's never had much trust in the gods. Wonder why.

EditorData.NodeContext: Smiling, sharing a joke with us. (Jaheira has spent her life fighting gods / children of gods)

Text.Value: And I him. Enough that I'll let him keep his lumbering, sweaty steed inside.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sniffing - referencing Boo's 'steed' Minsc, with whom she is unimpressed - then moving on.

EditorData.logicalname: LOGIC NODE - If no doppels, end

Text.Value: Back to himself, for better or worse.
Healers. This place could serve as a hospital.
I'm not fool enough to think I can change your mind. But if you're staying, I don't want you taking up arms - there are other ways to fight.
I favour the hammer. But ignoring her, I mastered at a very young age.

EditorData.NodeContext: Smiling, sharing a joke with us

Text.Value: Wait. One more thing. There are doppelgangers among the cult - be on your guard.
If I have to stay home and babysit, then it's your job to make sure there's still a home to look after.
Good. I owe him a kicking for showing Fig how to throw hatchets.
Hm. All right, then - if you turn up looking for hugs and kisses, I'll make sure to shoot first.

EditorData.NodeContext: Been told about dangerous shapechangers who might imitate Jaheira. Taking it in her stride.

Text.Value: Ignore Jaheira - if it comes to it, pick up a sword.
And Minsc?
...You shame me. In all our hunting, I had put them from my mind.
I remember. The very reason Jord had so many patients to hone his craft on.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wry. Her son only learned to heal by practising on the other children his daughter beat the shit out of

Text.Value: Aye aye, commander.

EditorData.NodeContext: Smiling - knows her daughter is fobbing her off because she doesn't want to get sentimental. Understands and lets her off the hook.

Text.Value: Boo is also very well. And happy to see you, Rion.
Prayer?
I... am well.
You'll get him back. I owe him a kicking for showing Fig how to throw hatchets.
A fair point, though I'll leave the herb-lore to Jord. I was always better at breaking bones than mending them.
That's my girl.
Really. Like what?

EditorData.NodeContext: Flat, eyebrow cocked. Humouring what she thinks is a very dumb line of reasoning.

Synopsis: Conversation with Jaheira's Daughter if your party has Jaheira in and your player is nearby. Mainly backstory and context for Jaheira and her daughter. It would be great to touch on why Jaheira''s nervous to leave Baldur's Gate without her influence to help build into the Timeless Body scroll story.
